meanings.definition: To take back possession of something, especially when the owner has failed to make payments.
meanings.sent1: The bank may repossess the car if the loan is not repaid.
meanings.sent2: He had to repossess the house after the tenant stopped paying rent.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to repossess the rabbit from the hat, but it refused to come out.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to repossess the stolen painting from the art thief's hideout.
meanings.sent5: The landlord had to repossess the keys from the forgetful tenant to show the apartment to new renters.

meanings.definition: To regain possession of something that was previously owned.
meanings.sent1: After losing his wallet, he managed to repossess it from the lost and found.
meanings.sent2: She was finally able to repossess her childhood home after years of legal battles.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to repossess its favorite toy from the playful dog's mouth.
meanings.sent4: The explorer repossessed the ancient artifact from the depths of the jungle.
meanings.sent5: The student was determined to repossess the top spot in the class after falling behind in grades.
